content: Smooth simple gameplay. Check it out
I played this on pc and I loved it but it keeps crashing in my phone
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear this. Please email support@spryfox.com and let us know more about the crash. E.g., does it occur on startup, or only when you do a particular action. We might be able to give you a workaround or refund the purchase depending on what the issue is.

content: Okay game, controls suck

The gameplay is cool and interesting, but the touch controls are horrendous. I accidentally picked up items every 5-6 times I tried to walk and many times it ruined the completion of the puzzle. Either get a controller (if the game supports it) or get it on console. The game is fun but not on the touchscreen.
A great game, but it crashes way too much on mobile. Play it on another platform.
A lovely concept and i just know it's beautiful becuase it's Spry Fox, but it's closing on me every five seconds
replyContent: I'm not sure, but you could be running out of RAM memory. Please try this and see if it helps: exit from all other apps, restart your device, and launch the game as the first thing you do.

content: It's a fun, unique puzzle rpg type game
I love this Game! One of my favorite!
The game is brilliant, but the mobile version sucks! It keeps crashing everytime I play it, so I would just recommend that you play it on PS4.
Great little puzzle game.
Overall great game but control is a bit fidgety
An emotional journey
It's a good game but if you can get it in playstation 4 I played it on there it'd way easier to control n more fun cause u can focus I only regret not buying it on ps4 n getting it on my phone
tricky, but engaging
cute, crashes often
replyContent:
I'm sorry to hear about your issue.  Please contact us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to take a closer look.

Sincerely,
SFS

content: Really fun roguelike with interesting puzzles and a variety of neat game mechanics. It does crash often, which can be pretty frustrating. UPDATE: I did try out the d pad controls, but it's still a bit bad, and moving too fast can make the game crash when there are too many objects. The ported controls are a bit slippery. Very much worth the purchase, though.
replyContent: I'm sorry that neither control scheme was that great for you. Glad that you had fun with the game, though!

content: cute and seems like it would be fun if it weren't constantly crashing
replyContent:
I'm sorry to hear about your issue.  Please contact us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to take a closer look.

Sincerely,
SFS

content: Nice game but crashes repeteadly after a few days without issues.
replyContent:
Hi there,

If you are experiencing an issue, please write to us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to take a closer look.

Sincerely,
SFS

content: Well polished, love the style

The best mobile game I've ever played is Triple Town by Spry Fox. I play everything they put out. This game has fantastic art, music, strategy elements, and an interesting story, however it also has a number of issues that will make it too frustrating for many casual gamers. The controls are imprecise and it crashes sometimes. The icons are too small to make out on my 6inch screen and it is a really challenging game even without these issues. All this makes sense to me only after I found out that this is a PS4 port to mobile. I didn't know Spry Fox did console! So if this game interests you play it on PS4 instead where it is so much better. If you want something for mobile play Triple Town. Both worth every penny.
Fun, challenging game. I love the style and the music but the constant crashing makes it unplayable.
replyContent:
Hi there,

If you are having issues, please contact us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to assist you! Please also include your device's OS version in your report.

Thanks,
Spry Fox Support

content: Love it

The dpad is too small makes this game almost unplayable. I love this game 
on my ps4 so was excited to pick it up for my phone. 10 minutes into the 
game and I'm ready to quit because of directional mistakes caused by using 
the dpad, tap to pick up, and swipe to move randomly working or reading 
incorrectly. I am sad I wasted the money on this game.

Great game, but randomly "minimises" and forcing reloads that rollback the 
game to the last loaded map is making it unplayable. (incidentally it 
happens on bushido bears too but no other mobile game.) Wish there was a 
fix.
replyContent:
I'm sorry to hear about your issue.  That's definitely bad behavior :(

Please write to us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to take a look.  Please include information such as your device model, OS version, and any relevant screenshots that may help explain the problem.

Sincerely,
Ray (Spry Fox Support)

content: Love this game and everything Spry Fox makes. Please give us more.

The game is virtually unplayable, it crashes too much. Don't pick up, 
refund and get something else
replyContent:
Hi there,

I'm sorry, but unfortunately the game wasn't actually designed to work on the Chromebook.  We'd like to make our games available on all devices, but this is very difficult for a very small company like us.

I apologize once again for the inconvenience.

Sincerely,
SFS

content: The controls were pretty bad, and the d pad is way too small. Causing a lot of moves to be interpreted as taps.
Amazing art, music, atmosphere. Equally heartwarming and somber. Im happy I got this puzzle roguelike, its really a gem. I only took one star off for the crashing issues Ive been having.
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear about your crash issues... Please email us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to assist you!

content: A beautiful turn-based puzzler that rewards, not frustrates EDIT - crashes out every 10 minutes or so - uninstalled :(
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear about your issue...  Please contact us at support@spryfox.com and we'll be happy to look into it!

content: It seems like a really good game, but it crashes so often I can't play. Is there a fix?
replyContent: Please email support@spryfox.com and let us know more about how the game is crashing. You're already on the most recent version, so no there's no fix, but maybe we can figure out what is causing the crash.

content: Love this game but the control's are so laggy and bad really makes this wonderful game bad! pls fix!
Keeps crashing...like the concept just wish I could complete something before the crash
replyContent: Please email support@spryfox.com with more information regarding the crashing. Particularly helpful would be a screenshot, description of what you were doing when the game crashed, and a device log that you can generate by following these directions: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/218506108

content: The game always quits randomly while walking around on my phone. Makes it basically unplayable. Controls also very bad, usually picking up or throwing objects by accident. Hope will be fixed
replyContent: I'm sorry that you're having difficulty with the controls. Maybe enabling the D-Pad controls in the options menu would help? Then every screen interaction is either a tap on a D-Pad key or a tap to throw--no swipes that could be misinterpreted as taps. Since the quitting is random it could be the device running low on RAM memory, but I'm not sure.

content: I just bought the game. It looked really interesting and like something new. The first 30 or so minutes were great. Great graphics, I love the overall idea of the game. The next time I opened the game, about 5 minutes in it crashed. I tried restarting it, force stopping it, re-downloading it. Nothing helps. About 4-5 minutes in, it crashes. Horrible. And I feel like I could actually enjoy this game too. Wish I could get a refund now though. Please fix.
replyContent: Please follow the directions here to send us a log of the crash: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/218506108 . The log may contain information that can help us to figure out what is going wrong on your particular device. Also, if the crash happens when a certain event occurs, please email us a screenshot of the room where it happens.

content: Surprisingly deep little Roguelike. Controls a a bit wonky but the gameplay is challenging and finding out secrets is a joy. Highly recommend!
Really fun game
Great game, controls are a bit wonky though
Great puzzle game, but controls are iffy.  Still worth a buy!!

It's a fun game if I'm not accidently picking things up or throwing things around when I don't mean to. The controls make this a frustrating​ game to play. Perhaps a long press for picking up and throwing would help. This game has been on Android for a while. It's disappointing to see the controls are still so sensitive.
replyContent: I'm sorry that you're having difficulty with the controls. Maybe enabling the D-Pad controls in the options menu would help? That would make every screen interaction either a tap on a D-Pad key or a tap to throw--no more swipes that could be misinterpreted as taps.

content: I didn't like it at first and i did get stuck in my house for a bit the first time i played but then i found the website with the recipes and i felt more equipped to play. Also the keypad for moving doesn't always send my guy where i intended.  Ive walked though quite a few spirits unintentionally.  Now I'm on level 9, but there is this one room that keeps throwing me out of the game, icy, goat eating flowers, 2 angry spirits, and a bunch of fire spirits, what gives?
replyContent: I'm glad that it sounds like you're enjoying the game a bit better now! I'm not quite sure from your description what is going on. Please email a screenshot of this room to support@spryfox.com, and in your email please also tell us more about what happens when you're thrown out of the game. (Screenshots of any error messages would be helpful, too.)

content: I love the overall experience and look. The gameplay is challenging. Worth what I paid for it! But it always crashes around 3 minutes after I start it...

I have this game on steam, just to purchase it so I could play on my phone.  There is something I would like to mention, whenever it is game over, I can't get out of that tomb screen. I had to close the app in order to either revive, or new game. I wonder if it's just me or it's a common thing.   Updated on 10th April 17, Still unstable game play for me, like frozen page after I gave villager some gift, music goes on but blank dialogue box, couldn't do anything but close down the app.
replyContent: We have been testing an update which includes a fix for an unresponsive state at game over--please take that when it becomes available and hopefully that will help. As for the new issue, please capture and send us a device log as you did last time so we can understand what is happening: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/218506108

content: Looks lovely, but the controls are horrendous. The d-pad use usless and has a mind of its own. And using swipes is laborious and rarely goes were you want it to. Would be so much better if you could just tap on the square you want to move to!

This is a wonderful game. It has a dark sense of humour and can be a bit tricky or marvellously challenging, depending on how much you want to push yourself. It's perfect for mobile in my opinion, as I find it quite addictive, so it's great to be able to take it with you. I highly recommend it.
Controls are horrible,  frustrating and makes game play almost impossible
I love Spry Fox's other mobile games, so I was excited when this game came to android. Satisfying puzzles,  great graphics, and surprisingly emotional life stories make this a game worth re-playing.

A great game hampered by inconsistent controls. If using the swipe controls, you should only ever move in the initial direction. It's frustrating to have my character suddenly veer off in a new direction because my finger accidentally slid a little bit. If I want to move in a new direction, I should have to lift my finger completely and swipe in a new direction.  The directional touch pad is useless as I frequently click a direction and end up throwing something instead. Also, I turned it off in options and it came back.  These significant complaints aside, the gameplay is clever and the graphics are beautiful and the problems are easily addressed, so I look forward to updating my review soon.
replyContent: Thanks for letting us know that the D-Pad is coming back on each game launch. I reported the problem to the dev team.

content: Mobile games tend to err towards quick and easy cashins. RNT is a wonderful example of what can be done on phones.
The art is cute. The game is terrible.
Great visuals. Shallow gameplay. Terrible control. Lazy port.
puzzleadventureroguelike
Great balance of game play, difficulty progression, story telling and design.. wonderful puzzle game. We need more games of this quality in the play store.. thank you for making this.

I have this on the PC and was very happy to see it ported to Android. Plays the same as the PC version. Movement is a bit stilted, and I end up picking things up I didn't mean to, but this doesn't detract from the game play.
Finished not to long ago and it hasent been 24hours but can't refund I would love to get my money back but no hate to game its amazing and keep up great work.
Its not for me

This game is very pretty but the controls don't make sense and I can't seem to find anything that gives instructions. Why is there a blueberry, can I eat it? If so, how do I eat it? There's a tutorial at the beginning but if I haven't played it in a while I'd like to see a manual somewhere.
replyContent: This may help regarding instructions: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/223735127-Tips-for-getting-started-in-Road-Not-Taken . If you talk twice to the fisherman in the village, he'll give you the option to replay the tutorial. There's nothing I know of that explains the berry, but you don't eat it; you give it to a villager as a gift.

content: Feels very juvenile and repetitive. Got boring pretty quickly.
Love the good asthetics and the puzzles are well-balanced in difficulty

Really unsatisfying 'feel' to the game movement and controls. For example even connecting three objects looks and feels unsatisfying, they need to wobble and connect, sticking together, instead they just stop moving. There's a lack of finesse to the kinetics. Looks very pretty though. Shame.

At first it was going to be a casual puzzle with a bit of roguelike element, and i will not going to play it after first tutorial level. Surprisingly i was not be able to, it had quite amount of depth. The puzzle element definitely become the main gameplay (mixed with crafting) but it blend nicely with roguelike. With spry fox cute arts and IMO a bit of dark story, you got yourself a unique roguelite game that fit nicely with mobile platform. My only cons is maybe the UI could be better

Poor controls combined with no way to fix mistakes or restart a level without burning through 300 hp really ruin the experience. Information pop ups cover the most important UI elements. Really needs an undo button.  Difficulty relies on increasing annoyance more than challenge, without giving more solutions. Freezes on death often,  although this can be fixed with a force quit and restart.
I hear so many great things about the game and I can't even get the game started without it taking me back here where I pay for it at
replyContent: I'm not sure, but your tablet may simply not have enough RAM to fully load and run the game. Please try the steps here to free up RAM: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/218506208 . If the game still crashes, please send us a device log as described here: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/218506108

content: This could have been a good game but the terrible Controls ruin it. They are really finiky amd often take the wrong input. The game itself is so-so. They added a ton of content but at the cost of tight gameplay and strategy. Do not recommend.
Good, hard game. My only problem is that I have to close out the game when I  die because the game won't proceed the killed by..... screen.
replyContent: Please email support@spryfox.com the information requested on this page: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000016068 . We'll try to help you from there.

content: Game just stops when I die or reset...
replyContent: Please email support@spryfox.com the information requested on this page: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000016068 . We'll try to help you from there.

content: Running on Galaxy S7. Game keeps freezing after I die. I've uninstalled and reinstalled to see if that fixes it. Controller support would be really great.
replyContent: Please email support@spryfox.com the information requested on this page: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000016068 . We'll try to help you from there.

content: So after two tries...the game freezes after the first mission. Black screens my tablet, and will not let me get out of the game. I have to turn off my tablet and then back on. Please help? Will give five stars if we can figure out the bug.
replyContent: Please email support@spryfox.com the information requested on this page: https://spryfox.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000016068 . We'll try to help you from there.

content: I've like a lot of their other Gabe's, but this one didn't do it for me. Controls are iffy, gameplay slow, side mission type content is annoying. It's a matching have that requires a wiki or lots of memorization. Boo.

This is a game I might have really enjoyed, if not for the faulty control system. It's swipe to move, but half the time swiping moves me too many spaces, or in the wrong direction, or registers as a tap rather than a swipe (or a swipe rather than a tap), etc. I pulled out my controller hoping the PS4 control system had been left in, but no luck there either. Manually mapping to my controller left me with similar issues to the touch controls - moving too many spaces, especially. Uninstalling for a refund for now. Might try again later if the control system is fixed. Especially if controller support is added.

Interesting at first, but all the levels end up cluttered with tons of garbage.  Moving between screens gets really tedious. Many of the objects in the game are very annoying, like the ninja bears which just teleport all over randomly and do nothing but get in the way.  Didnt care for the controls and making a mistake can permanently close an exit because you destroyed an object by accident.
Unrequited love, friendships, bunnies and bears. Can't say enough good things about this game.

As it is new the UI is awful. The love of iOS is apparent by their choice of tiny text and overlapping UI elements which most iOS people stubbornly endure. However on Android, this isn't acceptable. Text is tiny, some discoveries in the book match the colour of the background of the page. There is a HUGE waste of screen space left and right of which would have been better suited to a split inventory. Instead the inventory clings to the bottom overlapping part of the HUD. No Android credits, speaks volumes.

I like puzzles and I love rogue-like games but a combination in this way is annoying. Generally, rogue-like games are rpg in some way; puzzles tend to also be adventures. This combination works but not for me. I do like the fact that relationships can be established with NPCs and that you can interact with nearly everything but I don't like this game much. If I were sooner, I'd get a refund.
If you have countless hours for pointless exploration of secrets go for it! You will not be helped by the unresponsive control scheme!
Very enjoyable, but a bit glitchy at times. Also, the higher levels are quite difficult.
I love the gameplay and the game, worth it, but the bears are annoying AF!! Keep it up!

A wonderful RPG style, puzzle game with great artwork and a lot of heart. I've only completed two levels but the premise is fairly straightforward. I see hours of entertainment ahead. Better suited for continuous play instead of short spurts.
I love the puzzle with a story + rogue like features. It made a great PC game and an even better mobile game

This game is beautiful. It has cute characters, wonderful music, and a clean interface. As you move through the levels, it goes from simple to fiendishly difficult. But the next thing you know, you're questioning the nature of aging, what gives your life meaning, and your personal legacy. What do you leave behind? Whose lives have you touched? This game is well worth your time & money.
Own it on steam, not ganna pass up a portable version
This is a game with lots of heart. The play can be tricky at times with flaky controls, but it is rewarding once you get the knack for how the character moves. I'm enjoying the music and the visuals.

Words aren't enough to describe the high level of quality this game possesses. From the graphics and artwork to the game mechanics, Road Not Taken goes beyond being just a game, it's a downright experience. The price is well worth it, trust me, you will not be disappointed.

Loved this game on pc, so jumped on the android version straight away. Have to say I actually prefer the mobile controls. Love the art, and the slightly darker tone (story-wise) versus the other Spry Fox games. The gameplay is a good mixture of puzzle solving and rogue lite. Definitely worth the price, especially with the crazy amount of replay value involved (random level generation + branching story)

I enjoyed playing this on PS4 but always thought it would work well on a tablet or phone. The puzzles ramp up fairly quickly and give a good challenge. There's plenty to discover in the game and the whole thing is lovingly crafted.

A thoughtful and carefully crafted piece of art you can play through. Anyone shying at the price, what wouldn't you pay to avoid full screen ads, let alone for a high quality game? Puzzle meets adventure meets rogue like, I love it.
